snippet: The effects won’t be known for years, but Democrats will need to remind voters that many millions are already benefiting from the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Editorial observes that more than seven million people have signed up for insurance on federal and state health exchanges, remarkable turnaround after program's shaky start; holds figures provide stark evidence of demand for health insurance and willingness of people to comply with law that has been vilified by conservatives; contends, while questions about long-term effect of program remain, Democrats must continue to remind voters of its benefits in face of conservative attacks.
lead_paragraph: The effects won’t be known for years, but Democrats will need to remind voters that many millions are already benefiting from the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Measuring the Success of Health Reform
headline.print_headline: Measuring the Success of Health Reform
